join.HELP:
Join a particular combat.
  Join Arguments: `!combat join <Combat #> <Join Type # 0|1|2|3> <Character> <Craft Name - Join Type Dependent> 
  Join Arguments: `!c join <Join Type # 0|1|2|3> <Craft Name - Join Type Dependent>`
  Join Type 1: Permeant Craft | Type 2: Craft Type | Type 3: Join an already joined Craft as a Gunner | Type 4: Join an already joined Craft as a Crewman`
  Character: Callsign, First Name, Last Name for database characters; Generic characters are defined by G_SkillLevel_GenericName Skill Level can be Pathetic, Poor, Fair, Good, A, VAce

mission.HELP:
Generate a mission Name.
  Roll Arguments: `!combat mission` <with attachements>

leave.HELP:
Causes a character to leave a combat. 
  Leave Arguments: `!combat leave <Combat #> <Pilot's Name> <Leave Type [0,1]>` 
   Leave Arguments: `!c leave <Leave Type [0,1]>` 
   Leave Type: 0 means do not remove the craft; 1 means removes the craft and all occupants. Note persistent data will be saved if combat is real.

merge.HELP:
Merges two combats. 
  Merge Arguments: `!combat merge <Source Combat #> <Destination Combat #>` 
   Merge Arguments: `!c merge <Destination Combat #>` 
   All ships are removed from the source and placed in the destination.

transfer.HELP:
Transfer a pilot from one combat to another.
  Transfer Arguments: `!combat transfer <Source Combat #> <Character> <Destination Combat #>` 
   Transfer Arguments: `!c transfer <Destination Combat #>` 
   The ship is removed from the source and placed in the destination.

remove.HELP:
Removes a ship and all occupants from a combat. 
  Remove Arguments: `!combat remove <Combat #> <Specific Craft Name> <Remove Type [0,1]>` 
  Remove Type: 0 means remove craft and save all ship status and character data for persistent items (if combat is real type); 1 means remove and purge the data.

set.HELP:
Inhabit a character within a specific combat.
  Set Arguments: `!c set <Combat #> <Character Name>`

action.HELP:
Set Combat Action.
  Action Arguments: `!combat action <Combat #> <Character Name> <Action> <Target (when not passing)>`
  Action Arguments: `!c action <Action> <Target (when not passing)>`
  Target: Pilot Callsign or Ship's Name/n  Actions: Pass, Attack, Called=Front/Left/Right/Aft/Turret-Tag

in_corp.HELP: Kill the current victim. !combat kill combat combatant

xen_corp.HELP: Kill the current victim. !combat kill combat combatant

corp_por.HELP: Kill the current victim. !combat kill combat combatant

in_vas_grav_an_mani_in_corp.HELP: Kill the current victim. !combat kill combat combatant

in_vas_grav_an_mani_ylem_corp.HELP: Kill the current victim. !combat kill combat combatant

weapon.HELP:
Set Curret Weapon. 
  Weapon Arguments: `!combat weapon <Combat #> <Character Name> <Weapon Tag>`
  Weapon Arguments: `!c weapon <Weapon Tag>`

nav.HELP:
Set Pilot's Stance. 
  Set Next nav point: `!combat nav <Combat #> <Nav point name, spaces are OK>`
  See nav map: `!combat nav <Combat #>`

stance.HELP:
Set Pilot's Stance. 
  Stance Arguments: `!combat stance <Combat #> <Stance> <First Character> .. <Last Character>`
  Stance Arguments: `!c stance <Stance>`
  Stances: Banzai, Aggressive, Normal, Cautious, Evasive

damage.HELP:
Show Ship's Current Stats. 
  Damage Status Arguments: `!combat damage <Combat #> <Pilot's Callsign or Specific Craft Name> <(OPT) Show Type>` 
  Damage Status Arguments: `!c damage` 
  Show Type: 0/1 - private/public damage table; 2/3 private/public shield/armor VDU

show.HELP:
Show Ship's Current Stats. 
  Damage Status Arguments: `!combat show <Combat #> <Pilot's Callsign or Specific Craft Name> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>` 
  Damage Status Arguments: `!c show`

hero.HELP:
Applies Heroic Luck to a Pilot's Being. 
  Luck Arguments: `!combat hero <Combat #> <Character Name> <Application: Offense, Defense, KO, None>`
  Luck Arguments: `!c hero <Application: Offense, Defense, repair, KO>`

faction.HELP:
Sets a faction for the player 
  Luck Arguments: `!combat faction <Combat #> <Character Name> <Confederation, Kilrathi,...>`
  Luck Arguments: `!c faction <Confederation, Kilrathi,...>`

scan.HELP:
Scans something
  Scan Arguments: `!combat scan <Combat #> <Character Name> <DC>`
  Scan Arguments: `!c scan <DC>`

taunt.HELP:
Taunt Someone
  Scan Arguments: `!combat taunt <Combat #> <Character Name> <DC>|<Other character>`
  Scan Arguments: `!c taunt <DC>`

taunt_dc.HELP:
Get the taunt difficulty:
  Scan Arguments: `!combat taunt_dc <Combat #> <Character Name> <DC>`

get_focus.HELP:
Get a focus hint on a character
  Scan Arguments: `!combat get_focus <Combat #> <Character Name>`
  Scan Arguments: `!c get_focus`

cargo.HELP:
Adds Cargo to a ship
  Cargo Arguments: `!combat cargo <Combat #> <Character Name> <Item> <Quantity> <Hidden>`
  Cargo Arguments: `!c cargo <Item> <Quantity> <Hidden>`

viewluck.HELP:
View your current available luck. 
  View Luck Arguments: `!combat viewluck <Combat #> <Character Name> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>`
  View Luck Arguments: `!c viewluck <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>`

sheet.HELP:
Show a Character's Attributes and Stats. 
  Character Sheet Arguments: `!combat sheet <Character> <(OPT) Public-1, (default)Private-0>` 
  Character - callsign, first or last name

start.HELP:
Start a new combat.  Number must be unique. Combat will be either Mock (0), Real (1), or Autogenerated (2).
  Start Arguments: `!combat start <Combat #> <0|1|2|3|4>`

end.HELP:
Ends a combat, sequentially removing each combatant and saving states of permanent characters and ships.  Adding a 1 to the end purging the combat without saving states.
   End Arguments: `!combat end <Combat #> <(OPT) 1>`

branch.HELP:
Duplicates the current combat to the new number.  The new stack will start only include the current combat's round.
  Branch Arguments: `!combat turn <Combat Number> <New Combat Number>`

turn.HELP:
Turns the combat over, calculating the results of entered actions. Adding a 't' at the end prevents combat saving before the turn.
  Turn Arguments: `!combat turn <Combat Number> <(OPT) t for test>`

autopilot.HELP:
Displays an autopilot cutscene on the main channel
  Turn Arguments: `!combat autopilot  <Combat Number>`

jump.HELP:
Displays a jump cutscene on the main channel, removes the person from the fight
  Turn Arguments: `!combat jump <Combat Number> <Combatant>`

status.HELP:
Show Combat's Status of Combatants. 
  Status Arguments: `!combat status <Combat #> <(OPT) Status Type [0|1|2|3|4]>` 
  Status Arguments: `!c status <(OPT) Status Type [0|1|2|3|4]>` 
  Status Type: 0/1 - Table Private(default)/Public, 2/3 - Target Chart Private/Public, 4 - Webhooks Display Private, 0 - (default) Table private>

ready.HELP:
Analyzes and outputs overview of issues in combat.
  Ready Arguments: `!combat ready <Combat Number>`

comm.HELP:
Generate an NPC's message. 
  Taunt Arguments: `!combat comm <Combat #> <Sender Name> <Receiver Name>`
  Taunt Arguments: `!c comm <Sender Name>`

hack.HELP:
Attempt to hack into a computer system. 
  Taunt Arguments: `!combat hack <Combat #> <Action (start, guess, end)> <Sender Name> <Receiver Name> <Guess>`
  Taunt Arguments: `!c hack <Action> <Receiver Name> <Guess>`
examples: !combat hack Kurasawa_2 guess Maverick Computer password123

team.HELP:
Change character or characters' team. 
  Team Arguments: `!combat team <Combat #> <Team Name> <First Character Name> ...<Last Character Name>`
  Team Arguments: `!c team <Team Name>`

teamaction.HELP:
Set Team's Combat Action. 
  Team Action Arguments: `!combat teamaction <Combat #> <Target Type[1,2]> <Team Name> <Action> <Target 1 or Target Team 1> ... <Target N or Target Team N>`
  Target Type 1 is list of Character(s) or Ship Name(s); Target Type 2 is a list of Team Name(s)> 
  Action: Pass, Attack, Called=Front/Left/Right/Aft 
  Each target will be referenced by pilot callsign or ship name or team name (for type 2).

multishot.HELP:
Initiate Multi-Shot. 
  Multishot Arguments: `!combat multishot <Combat #> <Character Name> <Target Name>...<Target Name>`
  Multishot Arguments: `!c multishot <Target Name>...<Target Name>`
  Note: Character must be a gunner within a turret that has multishot.
examples: !combat multishot Kurasawa_2 Maniac Target1 Target2 Target3

touch.HELP:
Applies the Touch of GM to a Character. 
  touch Arguments: `!combat touch <Combat #> <Character Name>`

edit.HELP:
Edit a Character. 
  Edit Character Arguments: `!combat edit <Combat #> <Character Name> <Element> <Value>` 
  Character - callsign, first or last name 
  Element - XP, Luck, IncSkill, DecSkill

repair.HELP:
Edit a Character. 
  Repair Character Arguments: `!combat repair <Combat #> <Pilot or Ship Name> <Component> <Percent>` 
  Component: Armor, Body, or Component
  Percent: percent of body/component or raw armor value.

give.HELP:
Give something to a combat character. 
  Join Arguments: `!combat give <Combat #> <Character Name> <Luck or Weapon Tag> <number>`

report.HELP:
Generate a csv report
!combat report <Combat Number>

save.HELP:
Pushes the current combat to the combat stack within the database.
  Save Arguments: `!combat save <Combat #>

load.HELP:
Pulls the latest entry off the Combat Stack. 1 is latest entry, 2 is one further previous. 
  Load Arguments: `!combat load <Combat #> <(OPT) Prior Entry> <(OPT) Reorder Stack>` 
  Reorder stack: 0 or null just loads the specified entry; 1 results in the entry being placed on the top of the stack.

lock.HELP:
Locks a Combat's Stack, which prevents any more entries being saved to the stack.
  Lock Arguments: ```!combat lock <Combat #> <0 - open|1 - lock>```

delete.HELP:
Deletes the Combat and its Combat Stack. Warning: this cannot be undone.
  If the combat is a real combat and still open; it will ended first saving the persistent data before being deleted.
  If you wish to purge the combat, place a 1 at the end of the command.
  Delete Arguments: `!combat delete <Combat #> <(OPT) 1 - Purge.>`

help.HELP:
There are several sets of command groups: SYSTEM, DATABASE, COMBAT, DECK.
  For a list of valid commands by group, type: `!system help <Set Name>`

quit.HELP:
Disconnects Combat Bot.
  Quit Arguments: `!system quit <Opt: Backup? (0,1)> <Opt: Database FileName>`
  Backup?: 0 do not backup, 1 (default) backup | Database FileName: Master is default.

backup.HELP:
Backup the entire database (Combats, Characters, etc.) 
  Backup Arguments: `!system backup <Opt: Database FileName>`
  Database FileName: Master is default.

loaddat.HELP:
Load a database. 
  Load Database Arguments: `!system loaddat <Opt: Database FileName>`
  Database FileName: Master is default.

test.HELP:
Tests the system via test case provided via a text file. 
  Load Database Arguments: `!system test <Test Case File>`

roll.HELP:
Roll a random number between 1 and 9999.
  Roll Arguments: `!system roll <Number>`

jam.HELP:
Jam a message for you. Only jams items between << and >>
  Jam Arguments: `!system jam <message>`

jam25.HELP:
Jam a message for you. Only jams items between << and >>
  Jam Arguments: `!system jam25 <message>`

jam50.HELP:
Jam a message for you. Only jams items between << and >>
  Jam Arguments: `!system jam50 <message>`

jam75.HELP:
Jam a message for you. Only jams items between << and >>
  Jam Arguments: `!system jam75 <message>`

runic.HELP:
Convert a message from english to Runic.
  Runic Arguments: `!system runic <message>`

runic_img.HELP:
Convert a message from english to Runic.
  Runic Arguments: `!system runic_img <message>`

unrunic.HELP:
Convert a message from runic to english.
  Runic Arguments: `!system unrunic <message>`

genace.HELP:
Generate a Kilrathi A Name.
  Genace Arguments: `!system genace`

generate_mission_name.HELP:
Generate a mission Name.
  Roll Arguments: `!system generate_mission_name`

logger.HELP:
Retrieve logs between the two provided dates.
  Logger Arguments: `!system logger <Month-Day-Year> <Month-Day-Year> <(OPT) Keep OOC-1, (default) Remove OOC-0>`
  Date 1: Collect messages after the specified date: 12 GMT
  Date 2: Do not collect messages after the specified date: 12 GMT

export.HELP:
Export Database List to text format.
  Export Arguments: `!database export <item> <opt: textfile>`
  Item: a for all, c for characters, t for ship types, s for permanent ships, and w for weapons.

import.HELP:
Import Database List from text format. (text file must be correctly formated)
  Import Arguments: `!database import <item> <opt: textfile>`
  Item: a for all, c for characters, t for ship types, s for permanent ships, and w for weapons.

date.HELP:
Shows current date and time.
  Date Arguments: `!database date <add hours> <add minutes>`
  Hours: Admin Only: add a positive or negative number of hours and minutes to the current time.

list.HELP:
List the database items within the system.
  List Arguments: `!database list <category>`
  Category: combats, characters, ships, types, weapons, cargo 
    Note: types refers to vehicle types, weapons refers to mounted weapons, arms will refer to personnel weapons

view.HELP:
View an item within the database.
  View Item Arguments: `!database view <category> <item>`
  Category: ships, types, weapons, cargo, systems, notes 
  types refers to vehicle types, weapons refers to mounted weapons
  Item: uses the name of the item; for weapons
    Note: weapons must be referenced by their tag
          for combats access them with combat commands
          for characters use commands like edit and sheet

new.HELP:
Create an item within the database.
  New Item Arguments: `!database new <category> <Name or WeaponTag>`
  Category: ships, types, weapons 
    Note: weapons must be referenced by their tag

note.HELP:
Take doen a note.
  New Item Arguments: `!database note <mission> <topic> Notes`
  e.g. !database note kilrah_4 combat_notes Thrakhath always turns to the right.

edititem.HELP:
Edit an item, adding or replacing an attribute with a new value.
  Edit Item Arguments: `!database edititem <category> <Name or WeaponTag> <Item Attribute> <Value>`
  Category: ships, types, weapons 
    Note: weapons must be referenced by their tag

deleteitem.HELP:
Delete an item from the database.
  Delete Item Arguments: `!database deleteitem <category> <Name or WeaponTag>`
  Category: ships, types, weapons 
    Note: weapons must be referenced by their tag
  Warning: Deleting an item can cause problems

seekitem.HELP:
Find items where a given item is referenced - helpful to use before deleting an item.
  Seek Item Arguments: `!database seekitem <category> <Name or WeaponTag>`
  Category: ships, types, weapons 
    Note: weapons must be referenced by their tag

skill.HELP:
Skill:  Make a skill attempt vs a specified challenge rating.
VS Skill:  Make an opposed roll versus another character.
  Skill Arguments: `!database skill <Character> <Skill> <Attribute> <Challenge Rating: 1 to 50>`
  Skill Arguments: `!database skill <Character> <Skill> <Attribute> <Character> <Skill> <Attribute>`
  Note: Skills with spaces should be input using underscores for the spaces.

sheet.HELP:
Show a Character's Attributes and Stats. 
  Character Sheet Arguments: `!database sheet <Character> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

chargen.HELP:
Generates a new character with 80 XP available. 
  Character Generation Arguments: `!database chargen <Callsign> <FirstName> <LastName> <Occupation Tag>`
  Occupations: p = pilot, g = gunner, t = technician 
              no = naval officer, np = naval pilot, nc = naval crew, md = medical 
              mo = marine officer, m = marine, mm = marine medic

edit.HELP:
Edit a Character. 
  Edit Character Arguments: `!database edit <Character> <Element> <(OPT) Value>` 
  Character - callsign, first or last name 
  Element - XP, BXP, Luck, IncSkill=<attr/skill>, DecSkill=<attr/skill>, IncB=<attr/skill>, Check  IncB - increase a skill or attribute using your bonus experience points. Only non-critical skills for your occupation can use bonus XP.
  Skill - Note that skills must be written with correct spelling and capitalization. If the skill has a space, replace the space with an underscore in the command.
  Value - if no value is specified, a value of 1 will be used

name.HELP:
Change a Character's name. 
  Change Name Arguments: `!database name <Character> <Name Position> <Name>` 
  Character - callsign, first or last name 
  Name position - c for callsign; f for first name; l for last name; o for occupation

occ.HELP:
Change a Character's occupation. 
  Change Occupation Arguments: `!database occ <Character> <Occupation Tag>` 
  Character - callsign, first or last name 
  Occupations: p = pilot, g = gunner, t = technician 
              no = naval officer, np = naval pilot, nc = naval crew, md = medical 
              mo = marine officer, m = marine, mm = marine medic

look.HELP:
Show a Character's Description. 
  Look at Character Arguments: `!database look <Character> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

desc.HELP:
Enter a new Description for a Character. 
  Look at Character Arguments: `!database desc <Character> <Description Tag> <Description>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name 
  NOTE: Description Tag cannot have spaces.
  NOTE: Description can have spaces but must paragraph breaks must be entered as '+++'

listdesc.HELP:
List all of a Characters Description Tags. 
  List Description Arguments: `!database listdesc <Character> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

removedesc.HELP:
Remove a Description for a Character. 
  Remove Description Arguments: `!database removedesc <Character> <Description Tag>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

setdesc.HELP:
Set the Description that other characters will see when looking. 
  Set Primary Description Arguments: `!database setdesc <Character> <Description Tag>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

addquirk.HELP:
Add a quirk to a Character. 
  Add Quirk Arguments: `!database addquirk <Character> <Quirk>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name 
  NOTE: Quirk cannot have `n`.

removequirk.HELP:
Remove a quirk to a Character. 
  Remove Quirk Arguments: `!database removequirk <Character> <Quirk Index>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name 
  NOTE: Quirk Index starts at 0. Index is ordered Left to Right then Top to Bottom on the Character Sheet.

achievement.HELP:
Achievement:  Display an achievement popup with character, title, description, and color.
  Achievement Arguments: `!database achievement <Character><Title><(OPT) Description><(OPT) Color>`

achievements.HELP:
Show a Character's achievements. 
  Character achievements Arguments: `!database achievements <Character> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

kills.HELP:
Show a Character's kills. 
  Character achievements Arguments: `!database kills <Character> <(OPT) Public-1, Private-0>` 
  Character: callsign, first or last name

killboard.HELP:
Show a the total killboard. 
  Character achievements Arguments: `!database killboard <(OPT) all sim kills is -1>`

start.HELP:
Start a melee. 
  New Deck Arguments: `!melee start <fighter> <fighter2> <ai powered?>`

go.HELP:
start the combat round. 
  Melee Go Arguments: `!melee go`

set.HELP:
Set your move for the next round. 
  Melee Set Arguments: `!melee set <Strike|Grapple|Counter> <Fighter>`

end.HELP:
End the melee. 
  Melee End Arguments: `!melee end`

ROLE_HIERARCHY.description: Role hierarchy from highest to lowest privilege

roles.description: Game Master - Full system access, can edit characters, add luck, manage database
Combat Owner - Can control entire battlescape for their combat, cannot add luck or edit character attributes
Player - Can control their own characters and perform in-game actions
Observer - Can view information and roll dice only

ROLE_HIERARCHY.inheritance: Higher roles inherit all permissions from lower roles
